greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(0) = 0, a(n) = A003188(1+A006068(n-1)), where A003188 is binary Gray code and A006068 is its inverse.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: A101080(n,a(n+1)) = 1. [The Hamming distance between n and a(n+1) is always one.]
A268726(n) = A000523(A003987(n, a(n+1))). [A268726 gives the index of the toggled bit.]
mathematica: A003188[n_] := BitXor[n, Floor[n/2]]; A006068[n_] := If[n == 0, 0, BitXor @@ Table[Floor[n/2^m], {m, 0, Floor[Log[2, n]]}]]; a[n_] := If[n == 0, 0, A003188[1 + A006068[n-1]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 23 2016 *)
program: def a(n): return 0 if n<1 else A003188(1 + A006068(n - 1))
print([a(n) for n in range(0, 101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 31 2017
xref: Row 1 and column 1 of array A268715 (without the initial zero).
Cf. A268821 ("shifted square"), A268823 ("shifted cube") and also A268825, A268827 and A268831 ("shifted higher powers").
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 12 2016
